results.content: So this is my third course with Basir and one of many regarding React, Next, and HTML. The first thing for me as a photographer wanting to sell prints online is that the app looks good and maintains functionality. A bad looking functional app will be quickly ignored and a beautiful app that throws users error messages will be quickly closed for fear of credit card scammers. I think this course is a good mix of the two. Sure, we could add more authentication with google firebase and other  apps but I grabbed that from Dhungel's course. My reason for converting from react to Next was essentially the SEO and SSR convenience. But I will still look at Pug and maybe update my older apps. Biggest plus and why he received 5 stars - he answers student questions. Now perhaps that might be because the course is new. We'll see in a year or two if he is as available as he is today. But I learned a lot and the styling is clean.

results.content: Invest your time making videos very carefully. The code commits each video clearly, when I want to shorten the time by watching the changes in the commit, I don't need to watch the whole video. Short videos without redundant information help me learn faster. Thanks.

results.content: Desearia que se use CSS puro, sin embargo por la magnitud del proyecto creo que esta bien, un desarrollo rapido con Material UI

results.content: Brilliant! I needed NextJS for a quick prototype of my ecommerce app and this course fits my needs perfectly. Instructor takes his time to explain things and does not rush. This gives time for concepts to sink in. Topics are arranged in an easy to digest manner and move logically from one to another. Teaching style is warm and friendly. Kind of like talking to a friendly senior dev who knows his stuff and teaches you with a humble yet professional attitude. He's making NextJS a pleasure to learn and understand. I will share my experience as i progress through this course and for now i can say this course delivers on its promise!

results.content: Very through and easy to understand

Enroll if you understand React basics.
Basir don’t explain new react components, state and props. You need to learn them from other course. 
but as project based course, it is awesome. just watch and code what you see to build an ecommerce website like amazon.
